response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age", "high", "At 19, youth is associated with higher impulsivity and risk of recidivism."],
    ["Race", "medium", "Historical and systemic factors contribute, but caution is needed to avoid bias."],
    ["Criminal History", "high", "Nine arrests and convictions strongly indicate a pattern of criminal behavior."],
    ["Physical Characteristics", "low", "Height and weight do not contribute meaningfully to recidivism risk."],
    ["Marital/Residential Status", "medium", "Living alone without family support can be a moderate risk factor."],
    ["Educational Attainment", "high", "Lacking a high school diploma or GED is a strong risk factor for recidivism."],
    ["Employment Status", "high", "No employment during the past year is a significant risk factor."],
    ["Drug Use", "low", "Absence of recent drug use reduces the risk factor."],
    ["Mental Health", "low", "Not feeling depressed indicates a lower risk related to mental health issues."],
    ["Family Environment", "medium", "Growing up in a large urban household might have exposed him to unstable environments."],
    ["Religious Belief", "low", "Belief in a higher power may offer some personal resilience, reducing risk."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: At 19, youth is associated with higher impulsivity and risk of recidivism.
Historical and systemic factors contribute, but caution is needed to avoid bias.
Nine arrests and convictions strongly indicate a pattern of criminal behavior.
Height and weight do not contribute meaningfully to recidivism risk.
Living alone without family support can be a moderate risk factor.
Lacking a high school diploma or GED is a strong risk factor for recidivism.
No employment during the past year is a significant risk factor.
Absence of recent drug use reduces the risk factor.
Not feeling depressed indicates a lower risk related to mental health issues.
Growing up in a large urban household might have exposed him to unstable environments.
Belief in a higher power may offer some personal resilience, reducing risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 19-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 9 times and has been convicted. He is 6 feet 1 inch and weighs 180 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held no jobs during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 14, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
